lead_paragraph: One day after the state canceled a drought alert issued last May, an unrelenting storm brought more rain to Southern California today and forced rescue workers to halt a search for a man caught in an avalanche. Workers assembled 40 miles east of Los Angeles at the Mount Baldy Ski Area to hunt for the man, a snowboarder lost on Tuesday, but foul weather and fear of another avalanche forced them to wait.
